Just installed a seat belt mount in my B piller so thought Id share it on here.
Stared by finding the best place to cut a hole big enough for the mount plate to fit.
Decided on the back face of the B pillar half way down under the side panels.
I should of cut the hole a little higher or lower because of the cab door strike plate attachment on the other side got in the way.


I trimmed the sides of the plate so it would fit better inside the pillar, attached a piece of wire top and bottom to help me guide it up the inside,


pulling the wire up through the top hole I drilled earlier. I then fiddled to get the plate flat and held in place with a magnet so I could fit the bolt to hold the platefirm for welding.


The plate was cleaned of galvanised plating where the weld hole were, then mig welded and once ground down flat the anchor point is installed. easy..........

still not sure what to do about the hole in the bottom of the pillar yet though.

Does it have to be a specific height for mot?
Sorry for hijacking the thread!!

dont think the hight is specfied in the MOT test.Just if they are fitted they have to work. Mine use to be bolted to the top of the bulk head. I chose the height on the B pillar from just above where my sholder would be.

VW Technical Bulletin Z 14 gives dimensions for where VW used to fit them as optional fitments.
The MOT manual has no specification...

Here's how I made a support for a rear seat belt

I cut a 25mm thick block in a band saw with the curve of the inner skin that I got from a template made from cardboard.
I squashed a sheet on 1mm steel held together in a vice and with G clamps
with a bit of heat along its length I bent over both sides


With the steel still bent over the block I marked a line for the thickness and used the convect part to bend back the sides, again with a bit of heat


Did this twice


I trimmed the sides to 12mm cut the top to shape the roof seam and cut the bottom to profile the lower side panels
I welded the seat belt mounts inside at the same height as I had fitted the front mounts.


Painted the inside then decided to fit some lower mounts points as I did not know yet the best place for the reel and would not be able to weld them in once fitted.


because my bus is going for paint I spot welded them in place with a seam weld around the top and bottom. this will knacker any existing paint.
